node.title: COVID 'spot fires' to spread quickly through Queensland but system will cope, new CHO says
node.alt: Dr Gerrard speaking at a press conference with Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk in the background
node.description: On his first day as Queensland's Chief Health Officer, John Gerrard tells a media conference that with the border now open to all interstate hotspots, COVID outbreaks areÂ inevitable.
node.content:
["Queensland's new Chief Health Officer (CHO) John Gerrard is warning COVID-19 will spread rapidly through the community now the borders have opened, but does not expect hospitals to be overwhelmed.", "In his first media conference as CHO this morning, Dr Gerrard said the state's vaccination rollout had performed well above his expectations, with 88.3 per cent of eligible people aged 16 and older having received a first dose.", "Dr Gerrard said Queensland could expect \"more than hundreds\" of COVID-19 cases in coming months.", "The state has been partly basing its projections on Doherty Institute modelling, which assumed 80 per cent of the population would be fully vaccinated.", "So as Queensland inches close to 90 per cent fully vaccinated, he said the focus will shift away from the impact of individual cases.", "\"Everything is changing continually, most of our projections were based on the Doherty modelling which looked at 80 per cent maximum and we've exceeded that,\" Dr Gerrard said.", "\"I don't think any of us expected that.", "\"I thought we would be hard pushed to get to 70 per cent vaccination rates, so when they were talking about 80 per cent \u2013 I thought that was a dream.", "\"Now we're pushing towards 90 per cent.\"", "
Case tracking becoming less important
", "Queensland recorded one new community COVID case and nine in hotel quarantine from interstate and overseas.", "Dr Gerrard said the community case was a man on the Sunshine Coast, who probably acquired the infection while in\u00a0northern New South Wales.", "He said Queensland Health was investigating the man's movements between December 8 and 12, but that\u00a0the man had limited contact with the public during that time.", "Contact tracers have identified new exposure sites in Eumundi and Coolum Beach.", "\"Up until now, because of the high vaccination rates we've been seeing spot fires and for the most part the spot fires have been brought under control but as time goes by it is highly likely it's inevitable that the case numbers will increase,\" Dr Gerrard said.", "He said Doherty Institute modelling predicted the peak in cases would arrive in the cooler months.", "\"As we go forward, we will be focusing less and less on the individual cases and more and more on the trends and looking to see if we are getting exponential increases in numbers in the community and/or in the hospital,\" he said.", "Dr Gerrard said authorities expected mostly mild cases in vaccinated people, although the risk is still higher for some elderly and immunocompromised patients.", "\"I've been seeing COVID cases from the start of 2020 \u2014 people who are vaccinated don't get very sick. They might get a mild cold, these aren't people who will be filling up our hospitals.", "\"It's the small minority, mostly unvaccinated, who get very sick.\"", "
Omicron data not due for two months
", "Dr Gerrard described the arrival of the Omicron variant as a \"spanner in the works\" and said the state would not have meaningful data on the behaviour of the variant for up to eight weeks.", "\"We don't know for certain \u2014 the evidence says it's no worse than previous strains, there's anecdotal suggestion that it might be milder than previous strains, but there's no signal that it's worse.", "Dr Gerrard said early laboratory evidence has shown vaccinations are neutralising the virus, but urged all eligible Queenslanders to turn up for a booster dose of vaccine.", "\"With that booster, the neutralising antibody levels seem to be very important in developing very strong immunity against probably Omicron and also all COVID\u00a0strains.\""]
